name: Gallium trichloride
desc: Gallium trichloride is the chemical compound with the formula GaCl3. Solid gallium trichloride exists as a dimer with the formula Ga2Cl6. It is colourless and soluble in virtually all solvents, even alkanes, which is truly unusual for a metal halide. It is the main precursor to most derivatives of gallium and a reagent in organic synthesis.
Other anions:
Gallium(III) fluoride
Gallium(III) bromide
Gallium(III) iodide
Other cations:
Aluminium chloride
Indium(III) chloride
Thallium(III) chloride
